comments.text: Great spot, great people
Got taken by the local who went further to get us to vau deja than he needed.
Much better than trying from inside of the city. Got a ride with a local.
Very nice spot to get out of the city towards Vau-Deja. I got taken by two Czech tourists.
A cargo van stopped for 3 travelers. 2 went to the cargo compartment, 1 took a front seat. We were given a ride to Fier.
Lots of traffic in the right direction. Good place.
if you can't make it to Ohrid you can camp in this hotel for 10eur or get a room for 20eur. lots of space for cars to park. we got a ride with a Macedonian truck driver untill the border.
Somewhere here is a gas station. The owner was super friendly, and basically stopped the car for us. Don't forget to look behind you when driving, the view is breathtaking.

We got dropped of here with 4 people on our way to the beach and got a ride within a minute. The driver was a young pharmacist form the region with a very Balkan mercedes. Super kind dude drove all four of us to close to the beach.

A guy and a girl, it was raining. 
We had a sign that said "Patras".
An albanian guy brought us to the border with Greece. Cars go slow and there is space to stop :)
To Gjirokaster
A bit behind the roundabout is very good for going north along the coast. Local picked us (2ppl) up and got us a few kilometres up the road.
Not much traffic on this road in Fall -- after 30 mins and just a handful of cars, I caved and took the bus to Himare when it came by.
junction for cars going to either Gjirokaster or Vlore. very slow traffic
Many cars stopped. The people are very nice. We had a car directly for Greece.

Put a carton with Vlore written on it, two guys apparently friends took us, unfortunately they wanted money at the end (50‚Ç¨!), what idiots! they got the gaz money from us.
another guy offered us half the way, which stopped after 5min, good spot already.
gas station with cars heading to Greece, Gjirokaster and up the coast to Vlore
good spot. Some people here want money though, but you should be fine finding a ride.

We took a Taxi to get to this hiching spot.. But arrived just in time, the first car that came took us all the way to Shkoder. Driver was a customs officer at the border so had the fastest ever crossing as well ;) Perfect spot!
This is your place when heading to Albania.
The spot is great, but there aren't many cars during winter. Guy was going to Pilur

Not a lot of traffic, especially off season, but we (2ppl) got a ride with a guy from Himar√´ after not too long. He even went quite a bit out of his way to drop us as close as possible to where we wanted to go.
Perfect spot, everything is great and you will not stay there for long time. For me it was 2nd car.

One of the first cars I stopped took me directly to Elbasan (I wanted to go there) but he was continuing to Tirana, so if thats your destination this spot might work as well. A lot of space for cars to stop!
First car stopped on the ramp and we went to Vlor√´
a ride to Vlor√´

Started hitchhiking near this spot and soon a traffic jam formed due to roadworks ahead. I started walking towards the castle and a couple of minutes a car slowly caught up with me (due to traffic) and I was offered a short lift to the end of the jam (they went to the beach where I didn't need to go)

Good spot, speed bump slows all the cars down so they have time to look at you. We were really lucky because some hikers we saw in Theth stopped for us and took us to vlora (i had a sign Tirana, wanting to go to tirana and then to some beach)
Really friendly people, we got a ride to the center quickly
Really nice place, people are friendly and helpful! Love it!
good spot with shadow and a small parking lot to pull down for cars. make sure you bring water from the gasstation just before.
We were coming from vlore with a guy who lives in Fier; he brought us to this nice spot, after 2mins we were in a nice car going up the highway
Nice big street with parking places and nice shadow to hitchhike north.

less than a minute, a guy brought as to the new spot where the highway is starting.
comment: its far from vlore, but worth hitchhiking from there, 45 seconds of waiting!!!
Gas station and little restaurant. You can walk here from the city center (about 45 minutes) Every traffic northbound will go past this spot.
Coming from the lakeside, I found a ride instantly twice, going to Shk√∂der. Very nice people here.
works for north and south. lots of space to stop, caf√© with Wifi.
good spot to go to Durres, Shkoder or Tirana. Its currently (sept 2015) a construction site which offers lots of space for cars to pull over either before or after the gas station.
bus stop
We droped here and waited only 2 to 5 min. The car stoped for us and taked straight to Struga.
We droped here and waited only 2 to 5 min. The car stoped for us and taked straight to Struga.
We were two (guy, girl) to Macedonia. We waited only 5 min.

There're vans on the street which take you to the border with Macedonia. Can't remember the place they stop in the city, try asking people. Price is negociable (We only payed 2-3‚Ç¨) 
Once you get to border it is very easy to hitch-hike to other places in Macedonia (Ohrid, Skopje..)
first car stopped. Car was full but we could enter anyway.
The last petrol station in Girokaster.
Got a ride to the Macedonian border late in the night.
Hitched here once in 2004, waiting time: 3 minutes.
2 guys, lot of place to stop, and kind workers at the petrol station
Waiting without a sign for a ride to the border with another hitchhiker from Germany. After a while Albanian couple stopped not speaking a single word in English and took us to Honi i Hotit
Amazing people picked us up in 10min and brought to Skopje
Some kind guy picked us up with a car 7min after we started to hitchhike
There is some place for cars to stop, good spot for going Greece, but i dont suggest, i did mistake with it.
nice if you stand before the roundabout so people can read your sign while driving slowly and have time to pull over at the gas station
Nice spot to Tirana, probably worth to have a sign in this place.

It was madness. Due to low level of water my ferry stopped at this steep gravel road. Buses and cars had quite difficult experience with going up to the road. People from the ferry climbed to road by foot and waited for their buses which were stuck at the river. Since I hadn't got organised transport with ferry guys, obviously I hoped for some opportunity to hitchhike. While everyone was waiting, suddenly one local car showed up from nearby village. I thumbed and of course he stopped and took me
I was walking towards ferry, and czechs with campervan stopped and gave me a lift.

Likely you will be asked for money by some drivers or tourists mini buses, but it's also possible to hitchhike to Koman. I was taken by camping owner from Koman - Marco, great man. He asked me for coffee and raki in nice place on the way. Since most people here are living off tourism, of course I stayed in a tent at Marco's camping and he charged me for that... 2 euro. I paid normal price in his restaurant at least. So I advise to reject paid transport offers, but if you are taken by someone, it
It seems to be really easy to hitchhike in this area, great experiences
Early morning. Got picked up quickly. Dude bought us coffee and gave us cigarettes. Great guy.  + Town people are very friendly!
Got picked up quickly. Cars can stop easily. 2 friendly guys took us to Tirane.
Have hitched from here before, don‚Äôt remember how long we waited back then, but today was good.
After the border control there‚Äôs lots of space to stop. I was picked up by a shared taxi, but was lucky enough to not have to pay for the ride.
Easy to get a ride to Tirana here
We walked for a bit, but this is the spot! Cars can stop freely, guy with long truck stopped without problem and took as to V√∂re. Way better than other spots nearby
Easy but very very short ride to a nearby roadside cafe.
Went to Tirana via Elbasan.
A group of 3 was picked up quickly in the darkness. The driver was heading to Peqin.
The driver turned around for a group of 3, picked us up and drove to Elbasan (he was going to Tirana airport)
Caught a car to Durr√´s.
I was just sitting on a sidewalk (didn't hitch cars) and the second car which was passing by stopped in front of me and its driver gave me a ride to the main road to Tirana.
I was walking up the road and wasn't even hitchhiking but a van just stopped next to me and the driver showed me a gesture to get in. He gave me a ride to La√ß.
A van driver was going to Durr√´s.
The first car stopped and drove me to the main road to Tirana (a man went to Shkod√´r).
Didn't believe we'd hitch from the airport, but here we go
We were lazy to walk from the camping to the city center, and tried to hitchhike. We got a ride after 5min =)
We were lazy to walk out of the city, so we put our thumbs here, and the first guy coming stopped to drive us to the intersection Macedonia/Pogradec
it‚Äôs the direct road to durres
Hitchhiking with 3 people, super friendly people at the gas station. We got picked up by two friendly guys going to Podgorica for cheap gas.
We asked around on the campsite because it would be very difficult to find someone driving those small roads in the early morning.
Good stop. A lot of traffic jam but we didnt wait too long. We were 3
This is the Exit of the Port with a lot of Trucks passing by. Used a sign saying Kosovo and a Truck took me all the way to prizren.
had no problem‚Äôs getting to bilisht from here, our drivers were kinda dubious tho

Guys! It's the most picturesque view you can get in Albania! I walked here for 30 minutes and it was truly worth it!

This gas station is abandoned, so you can do urban exploring and it has a lot of place to stop with slow traffic.

Got a ride to Macedonia by very easily.
Last hitch in this road before getting to Theth. Good spot, not much traffic, but locals take. Or tourists who go to Theth if they have a spot.
Next to the prison, headed to Theth, got a ride to Boge
We (2ppl) got a ride north by what I assume was a private taxi, but we didn't have to pay. A bit confusing, but we got where we wanted.
Got spot, not too much traffic. We (2ppl) wanted to get north, so we got taken to the intersection.
We (2ppl) were walking up to the ferry and stopped a passing bus, that took us the few hundred metres and through the tunnel for free.
Got taken by a local with a pet lion üëç
Good Place where Cars can Stop at the Gas Station. After 5 Minutes get a Ride to Korce
We (2ppl) got taken very quickly by some nice locals. They kindly took us to a great place where we could pitch our tents.
We (2ppl) were walking back from the canyon when a car came by. I stuck my thumb out and they took us to the city.
Got a ride with one of the first cars to Poli√ßan. Very good spot.
The third car in more than an hour stopped and took me to Maliq. So barely any traffic but that means that most people will stop. It's a nice place with shade and a few houses.
Not very much traffic and mainly local. But I got in a pickup with some workers going home.
Perfect spot to go to Berat. Good amount of traffic.
Lots of traffic, solid spot right at the exit of the roundabout. Not a lot of space to pull over though.
Not very pleasant place, but does the job. Standing right at the exit of the roundabout into the 'Highway'.

On road to the 'Highway' leading south. The highway is not a nice hitchhiking road as it is a collector but also a highway, so you are well advised to try to get longer rides to somewhat bigger cities as standing on the highway is mostly not an option and in small towns there might be barely any traffic which might lead you stuck for a while. But a very good spot nevertheless.
Because of traffic jamming construction, cars were going very slow, otherwise there wouldn't be much space to pull over.
Lots of traffic, lots of space to pull over. No option for shade though.
Not a very pleasant place to stand, but lots of cars in the right direction.
Barely any cars but people will be very likely to take you.
Not much traffic, so most people will stop and take you.
Not ideal, since it's in a bend of the road without any real space to pull over, but barely any traffic so the drivers won't care.
Not a lot of traffic, but nice people. Got taken only a bit up the road.

Not so many cars were coming and taxis were standing at the intersection offering a ride for 20‚Ç¨. I walked along the road to be as far as I can from the taxis where I think cars don't want to stop as a respect for them. After that I only waited view minutes and was dropped off in Struga. The border was really easy to cross, I even stayed in the cars.

I went to Ohrid from Pogradec. I choosed not to go the way through Saint Naum Monastery, where there is less traffic. 
Several cars and buses came but they mainly showed me where the buses are. Then I was dropped off at the intersection between the road to Tirana and the one to Ohrid.
Got dropped off here and not even 30 seconds after someone stopped and took me to Lezh√´. On the white linea at the side of the road. Probably not the safest though
Wandering along the road, basically in the dark, still got ride. Albania ftw

Wandering along the road, didn‚Äôt even have thumb out when some random Gigachad offers me a lift on the back of his motorbike, not only all the way down the dirt road, also to the village. Not many cars here so don‚Äôt bank on hitchhiking, but this is Albania, anything is possible :)
Walli along road at sunset. Very little traffic but got a ride anyway cos Albanians are gigachads.
We hadn't even started hitchhiking when a guy stopped us and took us to the Montenegrin border.
I didn't tried it because I got a good ride but that's a good spot to go to the boarder Greece  in case

Good Spot some parking place before they slow down so they definitely have a little time to stop waited 15 min got a nice ride directly to the boarder my sign was for Korca or Bilisht he was driving over Z√´mblak to Korca there would be a good spot  at the full station to stay just one street  leading to go to the boarder. Hope that helps.
Its a good spot to go to Elbasan
Really good Spot to go to Gijrokastra or towards Greece border
Good road to get to Levan to the highway intersection
Really good spot to go to Fier or Vlora
busy road to border. watch out for beggers.
Very good spot. Quick ride. No shadows to hide from the sun but its worth the wait.
Excellent spot. Very quick. The shop mall is technically a ghost town but there is still traffic on the roundabout right at the corner. There is also a shadow under the bridge.
Hitchhike to north and south here, have to stop at the road connecting

After a bus breaking down and missing a transfer, we caught a ride to the border, made our way to this gas station, and 4 of us with a cardboard sign got picked up within 15 minutes direct for Tirana, after kindly declining, he bought us all redbulls and waters, nice and humble as can be
A lot of people ready to pick you up, good space to stop
So fast ! A lot of people going south from there
picked up and taken to airport very quickly using cardboard with airport, drivers spoke perfect english.
Just walking along the road, early morning with a sign saying aeroport. Albanian dude picked me up, didn't speak english but could use google translate, took me towards the airport.

Most of the Cars Go to elbasan or Tirana so its pretty easy to get a Ride.
We waited half an hour on a sunday.
Got the bus from Tirana to Kamez for 40 lec. Walked along the highway and stopped where there were no cars parked. Picked up within 5 minutes to go to Skoder
to south, a supermarket here
easy to find a ride back to Theth
space after roundabout, to Theth, now the road to Theth is paved, you will find lots of tourist cars
Very good spot near gas station. Got a ride to Teplene very quickly but we want to go to Durres
First car stopped us and took us to Butrint. Easy to get there from here
Got a ride to Lezhe in under 2 minutes.
Sign to Vlor√´, driver took us even to Durr√´s

A good spot!
2 people, picked up in 5 minutes!
Hitchhing to Tirana! A Audi took us between Lezha and Lac.
A local man took me here, said it‚Äôs a great spot and after the bus left I caught a ride immediately to Shkoder.
Lezh√´ to Shkod√´r. A bit after the bus parking, a taxi with other passengers took me for free.

So good place for hitchhiking 
Lezh√´ to shkod√´r

(+)
Place to sit in shadows.
(-)
A lot of taxi and bus drivers around.
Went a bit further past the mini bus parking. Took us 5 mins to get a ride to Shkoder.
Good spot, a lot of cars going to east. Better to use sign

Easy to get picked up, kind of a long walk from the center of town but it‚Äôs fine. Sunny. I would recommend using a sign and standing just before the gas station so people can pull in. I had a sign for Tiran√´ and got brought half way. 2 people (boy+girl)
Got picked up almost instantly by a German couple who took me to a town near tirana. Buses would go by and try to get you to go in
pretty good but theirs a aquarium with dead fish which is terrifieing
Good spot, but often traffic congested

Not to much traffic but enough, it is slow and space to stop. I went a tiny bit down the road towards berat (just to not wait at the round about). Tons of space to stop and I got a ride all the way to berat
Easy but short pickup for 3 travelers. Didn't reach Berat.
Not so much traffic, but enough. Lots of space to pull over, I stood a bit after the roundabout.
After the roundabout. A good spot to get a ride to Berat! 2 people, 1 minute!
Easy spot to go to Tirana, Lushnje etc, I was going to Lushnj√´. Long walk from the city and sunny
there is a small caf√© with space for cars to park on the highway entrance We were going to Elbasan, we got a ride to Fier with a local going to Saranda. Some cars stoped asking for money.
highway has a new feeder street, start of the highway, every northbound traffic is for shure here passing.
We didn't even have time to raise our thumbs that a car had already taken from us!

Just after roundabout lots of space for cars to pull over.
Think I got lucky because a German family in a camper took me to Ioannina. Only alternative for this connection is a bus at 6am btw if you don't want to wait in the sun.
to Greece/ blue eyes
We get ride to leskovik. Low traffic, almost every car going to the close villages. The road is ass
It will be hard to get a ride further, only few cars goes there. But that part of the road are extremely beautiful. It's worth to wait.
Cars didn't stop, 2 buses to Tirana came and wanted to take 5‚Ç¨, but we waited for 20 minutes and a young guy picked us up and got us straight to Tirana
As it worked to come to the city, we tried hitchhiking to come back to the camping (1h by foot...) and got a ride in 10min, at 23h00 =)

Took us 10 minutes to get a lift half way to Durres. Very easy for the cars to stop, make sure to have a sign and say that you want to travel without paying money before you get into the car. Very good experience with whole hitchhiking in Albania. People are super friendly. Also it is good idea to learn few basic phrases, since it opens many doors. :) IG @Tondyny

Nice place, although there is a lot of buses/minibuses going to Tirana from here. Note that a number of people would want money. Still, you can get good rides here. Had to wait 45 mins but had fun with drivers reacting :)
Petrol station at a big junction in the direction of Tirana/Ulcinj.
A group of 3 hitched a car to Lin. Spanish couple drove us into the city.
Very good spot for hitchhiking to Elbasan or Tirana. I got the ride after 5 mins, it was in 2017.
Good place to get a ride, didn't have to wait long.
Remember: not every Mercedes is a taxi.
Better than waiting on the border since this is the main road an gets also the cars coming from the Albanian side of the lake.
Going to Montenegro without a sign, in during Christmas. Two cars stoped, both offered a ride to Koplik
Good spot, shops nearby, got ride to the borders
We got a ride from Dutch tourist all the way to Theth
We asked a man who was buying stuff on the market. We were headed to Theth, he brought us to Koplik.

There are still road constructions and place is a little bit dangerous. I couldn't stay in this exact spot from the map due to some concrete barriers and I was maybe 50m closer to roundabout on the ramp. I was thumbing only the cars from this ramp, it was impossible to try with these from main road. I think it was about 5th or 6th car which took me, so worth to go there anyway.

First car took us. Because of road repairs and AL style of driving slow traffic, so easy to stop and more or less safe if with sign. Be careful - Google Maps in Durres are wrong, some roads are non existent

First car stopped, that's how it works in this region. My driver called his friend, who often rides to Kosovo. It turned out that he is leaving right now, he waited for us and I just changed the cars. Amazing, super helpful people.

Super low traffic. Like car every 5 mins but locals are here friendly so we got picked up by one who was just offering a lift to eveyone kinda. We drove to baijram curi. A lot of place to stop and cars are slow and see you for a long time.
Good spot cars go fast some time but in the morning there was not much traffic
Street out of Himare, Pulled my Sign out and after few Minutes 4 Girls from France took me to Saranda
Took us to airport, but people tend to ask for money here and are a bit surprised of hitchhikers
The ride to Shkod√´r.
We (2ppl) got taken at the entrance to the resort.
Good spot for hitching northbound.
Great spot to travel North. We got a ride to Durres quickly.
3 travelers caught a ride to the middle of nowhere somewhere between Tepelena and Gjirokaster.

Waited up the other points for some time, came here cause it's directly to Sarande/Gjirokastra, got a ride fast - from taxist, but negotiated for free, great guy
Were going from Durres and I think we could have got stuck in Vlore, so asked to drop us here

Goal: Kor√ß√´
Good spot, even if locals tried to help us saying it won't work. There is a direct bus to Kor√ß√´ for 200L if the hitchhicking doesn't work. Only down side: we met a gang of children, nice at first, but in fact very homophobic (we are girl+boy)...

3 cars stopped in only 3 min to go to Kor√ße. Because we are two women we decided not to go with the first car with two men. Than 2 cars stopped at the same time. There is enough space for them to stopp too
Got picked up immediatelly after we stuck us thumb out. Nice spot because people have to stop for the light. So we can looked down in their souls.
The car we came there hadn't even left and two Dutch tourists stopped and took us all the way to Vlor√´.
Everybody is going to Macedonia, just need to wait the one that will stop =)
It was kind of easy to hitchhike there, and also very useful to cross the border between Albania and Macedonia !
Lot of people made signs to say that they stay around Librazhd, but we then got a ride (with my worst driver ever...) to Prrenjas
It was dark evening. Good spot but not many cars passing through and if so they drove fast. But after 25 minutes we got a ride to Pogradec
With 3 people hitchhiking, we got picked up very quickly by a very sweet man who told us some nice stories about his life.

We were with four people on our way to the beach at Bax riolli. We were dropped of at this roundabout and got a ride in 10 min. The people for the last 5 km to the beach seemed nice but at the end the driver demanded money and got angry. We gave him some cash but it was a bit scary. First time that this happened to me after hitching 5000 km throughout Europe.
Not much traffic, especially off season. Nice place to stand though.
Good traffic towards the border and enough space. We (2ppl) got taken by a nice Albanian that got us a coffee and a bunch of snacks at a petrol station.
Good amount of cars to the border
Got a ride to the border in 12 minutes
Sign to Ulqin, Albanian guy with Munich plates took us to Ulqin
many drivers that want to "play taxi"
As always. Not so many traffic in Albania during winter. Was raining but luckily a Greek guy from Pilur took me near himare
An Albanian couple gave us a ride to Sarand√´ after a few minutes. Good spot, but not that much shadow.
To Saranda and further to Greece
Great spot, lots of traffic and easy space to stop. Got picked up super fast as a boy and girl
Didn't take long to get a ride. Even though there was a police at the roundebound.
Good spot, people are usually surprised to see us stop. Some stopped to tell us we should take the bus.
Super spot, really quick. We were 3 and we didnt wait that long
for some reason we decided to walk here which took FOREVER, but we ended up getting a quick ride to elbasan. Also felt completely safe on these outskirts of tirana
Not many people want to stop but in theory a good spot. High traffic and good place to stop. Got a ride to librazhd after 30 mins with a super nice guy who bought me dinner
Good spot to get a ride to Korca or in my case Pogradec
girl+boy couple, got a ride after 15 seconds to pogradec
We just arrived and we stared to hitchhike. The car stoped at once.
Plenty of buses go through here, either be ready to negotiate, or be careful what you wave at.
Not many cars in winter. Expect to wait a lot

Cars are very slow here because its a hill after a intersection. But it was very low traffic but mostly because we were hitching late in the evening (~6pm). Also it looked like mostly local traffic in the evening. I would suggest going in the morning when all the tourists are going to the other beaches.
Not even started to make a sign that a guy stoped and took me to Lukove
It was arranged ride for me, my previous driver called his friend and asked to take me to Gjakov√´ and he waited for us there. But for my look it should be good spot anyway.
Fine spot just maybe some cars go a bit fast. We were heading to kosovo but got picked up by local who was goig to the next town and went past it to take us to the main road.
I was heading to Kosovo, a local man picked me up. Spoke German luckily, so we understood each other. Took me all the way to the borders
find a ride to Berat
lots of outgoing traffic (and many vans). I spoke to the truck drivers in difficult English, but they got me on a truck that was passing by.
Instantly a guy picked us (4 guys) up. Not lot of place to wait and stop, but many cars passing.

We tried to hitchhike at the entrance of the fast road to Elbasan, even though it seems impossible to stop (and the police was on the roundabout so we were afraid that nobody wanna stop in front of them), someone stopped after 10min. Albanian people don't really care about the space to stop =)

The Albanians described in the comment above were probably not waiting for the bus but also hitchhiking (albeit for a fee), so they didn't give you bad PR, they just got there earlier than you. 

Regardless of that: easy spot for Elbasan, got a ride within 15 minutes.

The spot is very good towards Elbasan. The traffic is quite slow and a lot of cars pass. But when we were standing here there were 5 Albanians with us, waiting for the bus, but i guess they didn't know when it will arrive so they looked like hitchhikers and they were making us bad PR. But after around 25 min we got a ride.
towards elbasan

Got a ride all the way to tethi
(2 males)
Best stop for getting further down this road. Didn't get too far, but many cars are passing, for short rides. Headed to Theth - got there eventually after 3 short rides and one last long
Roundabout direction thethi. I think I was lucky and get a local guy who took me to Boge. Not much traffic... probably few tourists.

5/5 star for me but I am giving 4 stars because I think I got lucky. Picked up very quickly for a ride to Tiran√´ but the traffic is going fast so you might be stuck for a while. Make sure to hitch far enough ahead that fast cars can pull in behind you before the ramps. Boy + girl with Tiran√´ sign
To hitch to Kosovo just walk a bit up the exit and there's a spot where taxis hang out and buses stop. Got a ride in 1 minute!
A lot of private taxis. Only the 4th car would take me for free. (Direction Shkoder, after the roundabout)
Roundabout in construction. A lot of space to pull over.
Location is wrong -- the petrol station is a bit further down the road. Anyway, poor spot in my opinion. Waited almost 2 hours and got only illegal taxis who wanted absurd payments.
There's a petrol station here with space to stop. We just put out a sign "Tirana" and got a ride soon enough.
Got a ride to Tiran√´ in 10 minutes at a petrol station.
The shopping mall's name is TEG. There is a big roundabout where cars slow down.
It is a place near biggest shopping mall in Albania, biggest in Tirana. The road is going to Elbasan, and from there also towards Macedonia (Ohrid).
There is a bus going this direction (forgot the name), then walk a bit further to a place where cars can stop.
not many cars towards Macedonia. I started walking towards the border and got picked up soon
Not a lot of people want to stop. Got a ride about 20 mins down the road and the guy ended up buying me a bus ticket to Elbasan
stuck my thumb up on the road just outside the bus station. got a ride straight to Elbasan in 10mins

Maybe we didnt get lucky but there was only tourists cars going feom blue eye. Most of them were filled with families, so didnt have place for 2 people. But eventually very nice moroccan tourists picked us up to sarande. Also not much place to stop but traffic is low so its fine.
First cars with tourists took us (2ppl) to Ksamil.
Not the best spot, a lot of people were walking on the pavement at the end of the day. A nice French couple took me on their van, they let me 5-10 km farther.
Good traffic, also off season. We got very lucky with a nice Albanian taking us (2ppl) all the way to Tirana. Had a nice conversation about the Albanian politics.
Technically a good spot, but still difficult to get to the border. After 30 minutes a taxi took me to the border for 500 lek.
A petrol station, ok place to go to the border! It's better not to write "Greece" (or write and show only the campervans). 2 people, waited 30 minutes.
Slightly risky spot, very much feels like the side of a motorway. However, good for heading West (towards Durr√´s). But, only go to Durr√´s if you like Magaluf! Mistakes were made
It's not the safest spot, BUT it's the only place we found along the highway, where the cars ride sliw enough to stop. We got a ride in 5 minutes!
Get a ride for free to berat direction
I walked across the railway bridge and hitchhiked after it. Also a good spot.
good spot to go to Shkoder

Two (male, Female) hitchhiking to Tirana. 
A truck driver took us to Tirana.

Two (male, Female) hitchhiking to Tirana. 
A truck driver took us.
4 hitch-hikers together wait 10min to go to the montenegro border
koplik, direction Montenegro
we wait just 10 seconds and a car drive us to the center of tirana !
Towards any city in the north, traffic is ok and much place to stop.
To Gramsh
Towards Berat and Corovoda canyons.
From this point you can go south to almost all southern cities of Albania. Vlora, Fier, Berat, Gjirokastra, Saranda etc.
To Fier, Berat, Vlora, Saranda, Gjirokastra and South Albania.
You can get a ride to Elbasan evry 5 or 10 min from here.
This direction is much more easy than oposite way.
lot's of space, no problem for trucks and busses to stop

Just after the roundabout, not much space to stop but still ok.
Many car go to Pogradec so it can be a first lift if you go further north.
trucks going to Montenegro pass here. We were picked up by one going all the way to Holland
Good place to go to Macedonia. Albanian people will take you only to the border though..
To Kosovo
In spite of lots of illegal taxi asking you for money there are lots of possiblity to get pogradec and the border with macedonia
There is a very good water spring where everybody stop to fill their bottle u can easily find a lift north to Tirana but hardly east to kelcyre and Permet. anyway doable.
Just before the bridge it is easy for cars going towards Tirana and the coast to stop
Ok spot for going to Tirana or towards the north. A bit of a walk from the center though.

The classic route to Pogradec is the short way to the Ohrid lake, but this route climbs to 1300 meters above the sea level, and in january, we even saw snow there. And beautiful views of canyons and the lake from the height.
Not much traffic but I got lucky and got a ride all the way to struga very quickly.
The car have a place to stop, and many traffic to Tirana. Easy
Not too much space to stop but was really fast

There is no space for a car to stop but it's Albania so who cares. The car was going to Kosovo. I was heading to Valbona via Bairam Curri. The driver said that the majority of cars go there via Kosovo nowadays. I couldn't go there so had to stick to the old road.
Not so many cars in the evening. I'd question this route to go to Valbona, oh well... Eventually caught a ride to Krum√´ at around sunset time.
Hitched a van in the curve. Went all the way to Kuk√´s.
Stupid bus #4 terminated not at the city park but near Vor√´, far away from the intersection of highways. Had to get back to the main road later.
Heavy traffic but no one stopped for a while until I caught a local going to Tepelena. Was hitchhiking at a gas station.
Not the best spot due to high speed of course. Except the majority of cars going toward Vlor√´.
Very low traffic, this is the dead end road. However, we easily caught a car going all the way to Vlor√´.

There is a local grocery store at the spot where you can hide in shadow while there are no cars on the road. Eventually a group of 3 was given a ride to the exact part of the Seman beach which we needed. Driver's destination was different but he kindly drove us to our location.

We needed to go toward Seman beach. Almost immediately a car with 3 locals inside stopped, they were following the same road for a while. We were a group of 3 too. One local passenger was put in the trunk, a girlfriend of my buddy sit on his knees. What a ride!
3 travelers were picked up in the darkness and given a ride to Berat.
A group of 3 was picked up quickly in the darkness and given a ride to Lushna.
If you end up here you're likely to get a ride towards Kosovo reasonably fast, there's a shop and a cafe there as well
Traffic is sparse there but you'll likely be taken to a better place to catch a ride towards Kosovo.
comming from Vlor√´ going to Elbasan a couple left us here, not a great spot because is roundabout, on the sun and not much space to park but we got a ride fast.
Caught a car going to D√ºrres. Before was offered a ride to Tirana for 20‚Ç¨ (refused) and another ride on a very short distance (refused too)
Was given a lift by two Albanian dudes heading toward Greece.

Goal: Pogradec
Got a ride in few minutes, when the day was getting dark, so perfect! Not the perfect spot for cars to stop though
There some place to stop and drivers dont go too fast. Got picked up by local who was going to gjakove in kosovo.

We wre trying to get to koman lake ferry and were taken by a tour bus ehich was very suprising. But they took as all the way. Not much place to stop but no one cares because the traffic is low and kinda only in one direction in the morning. Everyone is going to the ferry. But mostly its tours and stuff. Not many cars. So if it can be hard to get picked up because tours dont pick up you often.

Instantly got picked by some guy who agreed to oick us ul to vau dejes but when we said that we need a bit further he said sure i will drive you there. Pretty nice spot. Looks like only locals who are very friendly.

Good spot. Better to wait after the bridge if you are going north. Because people are more willing to stop flat ground. Not much space to stop but its fine because traffic is not big. Sad we didnt go up the scenic route to vlore but we couldnt complain.

We didnt want to walk up the hill so we chose this spot because a lot of traffic which are going around himare are coming from that other road so both flows are connecting here. Drivers are slow because of a roundabout. And there is no shade. But nice swiss couple took us to next town

A bit not nice spot because drivers are going on the small road so they are not think about you but they see you for a while and there a parking lot to stop. We got picked up by albanian group going in the minivan. They went past us and turned around and picked us up :DHDHDHD.
We cbose this spot because of thw sahde but its pretty good because not local drivers slow down before the turn.
Not the best spot but there is a bump thingy where cars have to slow down. An Austrian camper girl took us to borsch.
Many cars going from the shopping centre, they will definitely be honking at you, but Albanians are helpful and so nice, so few minutes and you will get a lift

We went here to go to the coast after staying on campsite legenda close to here in skoder. Good bakery and we also got a short ride with 2 dudes with their jetski. They were confused and dropped us of at the next exit but cool dudes nonetheless.
Not that good of a spot, cars dont have much space to stop for you but alltogether we stopped like the 20th car we saw, local albanian man took us to shkoder so pretty good!
a taxi took us a bit unwillingly to the border where we walked across
this is the main road from tirana to korce, everyone goes through here. super long but very scenic drive
Some cars, but none of them stopped. The gas station employee saw me and helped me to hitchhike. The second car stopped, a kind young Albanian drove me to Berat.

It's a good spot to catch rides, only not much traffic going my direction at this time (3 cars during 2 hours).
Try to get a ride at least to Dushaj (basically everyone should go there) and then there are more cars already around.
On the highway, not a pleasant place. But we (2ppl) got a ride all the way to Skhoder from a car coming from the on road.
Not much traffic and not everyone will take you. Nice spot though. I got taken by a truck, which was cool.

First we (2ppl) waited a bit further at the petrol station. Just next to the fence is a lot better though. We got taken just a bit to the next roundabout, because the local that took us did see it as a much better spot to hitchhike, which was true.
Not a very pleasant spot, as well as not too much traffic in off season. But we got taken quickly by a local. (2ppl)

We waited at the parking spot, but there is not a great amount of traffic at this time of year and mostly full Albanian cars. At some point we got taken by a Canadian tourist all the way to Gjirokast√´r.
Tried to hitch a ride there, but not many cars and rain. The owner of the small market there then saw us (2 ppl) and took us all the way to the hot springs.
Cars go relatively fast and there is not a lot of space to pull over. But it works.
Not a lot of traffic, but otherwise quite nice place.
Long parking space after the bridge, before the gas station. Can be a bit chaotic but cars have to slow down due to traffic. Many cars passed (~9am)
A nice  truck driver took me to Lushnja, its a good spot to go to the cities in south Albania
Verry nice service at the gaz station, they led us to charge our phones. Guys took us to the bigger station at the highway. The road is less busy because of the new highway.
some guys took us to Durr√´s. it is an older road but still pretty busy.
Grat Spot to ride to Librazhd or even Pogradec
I asked people at the gaz station

Basically the only road from Albania to Kosovo so there‚Äôs tons of traffic and everyone is going to Kosovo (there‚Äôs not much in Albania on this road). Be prepared to pay though, but I got a ride straight to Prizren
bus stop, direction to south
Quite a bit of traffic. A tree for shade. Cars must slow right down because of uneven road surface. Got a ride only 10 minutes to Mesopotam but from there waited for a ride to Blue Eye.

Good spot to Macedonian borders. (Harder way to Macedonia bit more beatiful) Not many cars going there but one Holland guy took us to the  border so we crossed them by foot, went to look to the nearby church and then continue hitchhiking
Good spot. It was getting dark but we got a ride to Libharzd. We were heading to Pogradec
Good spot to Tirana. We got a ride there quickly.
The road is uphill so its not very good spot but we got ride very quickly to the Blue eye
A lot of cars going from here to Sarande or Ksamil. We got ride to some beach in Monastir
Good spot to Durres and more South. After few minutes we got ride to Dhermi with a place to stay over night
It's a good spot to get a ride southwestward. It seems weird, but that's where the locals stop, so it worked... We were 2 people and got a ride in 4 minutes.

We had a sign with Teth and just by walking along the road, random guy asked if we want free lift. You can literally stay anywhere and just stop the cars going direction north. It should be easy to get ride to Podgorica as well. Good spot, really
Good spot to Podgorica, but make sure your lift is for free!
It is not easy to hike here as the mini-bus going north is near-by, luckily we were picked up by a small trawlers going 5km further.
found a direct ride until leskovik, good to have a sign saying "erseke". a lot more cars going in summer than in winter

The only road to go towards Ersek√´.
We were lucky that there was a huge festival in the city, otherwise the traffic is even lower. 
So maybe check the local buses.
Not always a lot of traffic and maybe not the most perfect spot, but it works well.

We (2ppl) got a ride here that took us all the way to √áorovoda. But there, the driver wanted 5‚Ç¨ per person. As he only spoke Albanian another local translated for us and later apologised for the driver. He didn't have any sign or said anything that he could be a taxi driver. In the end I offered him 2‚Ç¨ or nothing and he walked away.
No one stopped at all. Raining a lot. Gave up and walked all the way to Dhermi until someone stopped to me
Good spot, people stop, a local took us a bit further.
Was waiting for quite a while and eventually was given a lift halfway to Durr√´s only.
I waited for a while and although there was a lot of traffic, the first one to stop was a bus which I took for 40 cents to Durr√´s.
Was given a short ride after more than 1 hour of waiting. There was enough space to pull over but the place was full of poor people begging for money in the oncoming traffic jam.
no space to stop but still got taken by the first car almost to tirana
Many tourists, people are nice
Lots of tourist going down from the mountains
Got a ride to Erseke after almost 1.5 hrs
Enough space to stop a cars, but not to much cars passing

this is the road to the Greek border, so it has very low traffic as only people are using it who want to enter Greece. we were very lucky because got picked up by the 10th car, but for this we waited 30min. there are no trees, and the space is in a valley, so it was very-very hot and the sun was crazy strong. have water with you, and cover yourself (or use umbrella), because the sun can harm you badly, and there is no place to hide.
Almost all the drivers will ask you money but also after you say that you dont have money they probabily will take you.
If you have a chance, take this very scenic road over the mountains to Tirana. The spot is not great but the route is worth the trip.
Can confirm, this route is fucking hard until Erseke, then traffic picks up a bit again.
Low traffic but if u r lucky like hhikers always are u can do it!;) further leskovik is gonna be even harder until Erseke
This is the spot to go to Korca. Locals asiking for payment 200 leke
picked up by car from Cerem, back to B-currie
we tried hitch hiking instead of taking the ferry leaving the region. We were picked up but not going very far
Good traffic but lots of taxi driver assulting literally you when u cross the border from greece.

ATTENTION: The road from Skoder to Podgorica is unfinshed and the border section between Hani i Hotit and Bozaj is closed for construction until 17:00.
If you plan on ging to Montenegro, take the other border towards Bar.
Hitched here once in 2004, waiting time: 3 minutes.
Walking down this road with a 'TR' sign I had a direct ride in 15 min.

was walking since Himar√´, expecting a ride to vlore. But no one stopped. 
A postman took me in Dhermi and said he was going to Tirana. I accepted and we had a nice trip

Not the best spot out there, mainly because you have to stay squeezed between the road and the bike lane so as to be visible (and you'll be nagged by the locals about taking the bus). I got a ride to Milot in like 30 minutes though, so if you can manage these inconveniences it's definitely not a bad place to try.

Unusual long wait for AL, but got a ride to Vlore, we do to Saranda
Cars can stop on the bus stop, but might be police around + many ask for money
My son and I waiting for the bus to Ksamil. But there were no buses. And +40 degrees. This is a bad place to stop, no shadow. But we got to Ksamil :)

After being dropped at the border we arrived here at dusk after a full day of hitching from Bosnia. We got a ride with two Turkish dudes who took all four of us in the back. Great guys but after 10 minutes we got stopped by some shady policeman who thought that we were being snuggled. They   were a bit upset but after a couple of minutes they found out that the drivers boss knew one of the officers. 5 min later the boss showed up and cleared the air. After continuing the driver told us he played
We (2ppl) had to wait for quite a long time just to get past the big intersection, to get to the sea. Not the perfect area for hitchhiking.
Not a great spot, too much traffic. But we got taken quickly.
Way too busy and no space to pull over. Better to try at some other intersection. Got taken
As almost always on the on roads to the highway, there are only few cars and they don't stop. Maybe it's possible to stand on the highway but not very pleasant.
Not many cars drive and fewer stop.
Nice ride all the way to Fier. Many people went in our direction but they usually didnt go far enough. Longer waiting but its worth it. The service at the gas station is nice.
Great spot to Tirana

Walked along the by-pass with arm out. Not very busy but we got a ride to get to the border within 40 minutes and the people took us to the border crossing which was out of their way. We walked across the border with no issues.
to greece, not many cars
to south, easy to find a ride but cars are fast

There is a gas station with lot of dogs so they get a lot in the way. Maybe it is better to stay in the We were hitchhiking in late afternoon when almost everyone were going to Sarande. But fortunatelly we got a ride to Gjirokaster
Not the best spot but a lot of cars going to Sarande so we got a ride there
Not the best spot but we could not even write a sign and got a ride to Ksamil. Watch out for ,,taxis,, and people who want money for the ride
Not many cars passing by in the afternoon and lot of them were going north or just nearby. After 45 minutes we got picked up with two guys from Germany straight to Sarande
Not many cars passing by. After 30 minutes we got ride only down the hill on a bit better and warmer spot. Because here it was so cold

Not the best spot. People are going a little bit fast and there is just a little space to stop. 
After 30 minutes some older guy on a bike insisted on going with him. So we went to the firts roundabout where he stoppedin the middle. He was stopping the cars and saying them to take us. After few minutes some guy rescued us and took us near Tirana. We are heading to Sarande

Right next to the shuttle service. This looks like a bad spot and I only had a low resolution screenshot of the map so I thought the other green dot was this place. I was almost tempted to take a shuttle to the near village 25 min away (5‚Ç¨, tourist price I guess), but a ride straight to Tirana made me glad I didn't do it.
We found a ride but people where generaly hesitant to take us to the border
Not the best spot, cars are a bit fast... but we got a short ride after 20 minutes. The advantage is that if you give up, you are already in the bus station...

Vlore-Sarande: This was one hell of a journey hitchhiking. It's a good road to hitchhike down to Himare. But after that, the traffic dies out to eventually nothing. Had the pleasure of hitching a number of short rides to beautiful places, but eventually left me to walk almost 10 KM until almost sundown. I luckily found a ride about 15 KM's north of Sarande into the city, otherwise I would have been stranded.
Nobody stopea. I went to SH3 and got ride by microbus for free to Perrenjas
we took a short lift to the junction where you have much more traffic!
Better to walk a bit further to the SH3.
Decent spot for cars going into Albania, they come out of the border crossing slowly. Ignore the obnoxious taxi drivers.
One car per hour.
car is really really infrequent, we waited for 1 hour for two hikes back to the highway to Tarane. We are just too lucky for the second hike to go a long way zig-zag among mountains

Gasstation before Kukes; no good. Local traffic and lots of traffic on the highway turning into Kukes

Find a ride into Kukes and walk towards the road leaving town. There I had a ride to Tirana in 15 min (and lots of offers for (shared) taxis.
I was walking down the street, and thumbing at the same time. A sketchy Albanian picked me up, so I asked to be dropped off at the toll station.

Mostly traffic only from ferry so hard to get something and it would eventually. Maybe it would be better just to ask people leaving the ferry for a lift. But some crazy guys stoped who were driving around the mountains and took us to the next town.
Very bad spot to hitchhike with a thumb. Dont even try. No place to stop and cars going fast. Take the bus or make a sign and ask drivers going from the beach if they atleast goi g to himare.
do not stay here for going towards the north, a lot of cars but no one stops

Don't know if it's possible to go directly to Kor√ßa from here. I got advised by a nice old lady that couldn't speak English to try to go to Bratile by bus and go from there. There are many busses going that direction so I only had to wait a few minutes and then a bus took me to a more promising place near Bul√ßar.

After 2h30 a albanese took me to the border, but there is not a lot of car, and few of it cross the border (at least, a saturday evening). Some young albanian told me that i will never get a ride cause greeks dont take hitchhikers.
Incredeble bad place. Just if you have time you can go from here to beatiful villages. Here you can wait car one day. So be ready for that. This road is not so good like in the google maps
We were going to Shkod√´r. No one goes to Shkod√´r this way. The locals moved us to a gas station on the highway and we were taken in less that 5 minutes.

If you want to go schkoder/montenegro, DO NOT USE THIS ROAD!!!

although it looks more direct, it is a tinyass single track mountain route with basically zero cars, all going super slow. itll take a whole day to get there. stick to the main road (e.g. a car to tirana). get out at the main road junction near lac (there is a good spot) and hitch north from there. 

I got out here, hitched part way along, and then realised my mistake and hitched back, losing 5 hours. the first cars here did sto
The entire ‚ÄúShkod√´r bypass‚Äù is fenced and there is no curb. Impossible to hitch. There is also not much traffic, much better to go to the main road depending on your direction to hitch
